question:
Consider the subspaces of $\mathbb{R}^3$, $S_1$  generated by $A=\{(1, 0, -3), (1, 5, 7), (3, 5, 1)\}$ and $S_2=\{(x, y, z): x+2y=0\}$. 
The dimensions $d_1$ of $S_1\cap S_2$ and $d_2$ of $S_1+S_2$ are:
Determine which of the following functions  $f\colon \mathbb{R}\to\mathbb{R}$ is surjective.
topic_name: Real Functions of a Single Variable

question: An orthogonal basis for the subspace $S=\{(x, y, z): x-y-z=0\}$ of $\mathbb{R}^3$ is:
Choose the right answer:
answer1: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is an orthogonal linear operator
answer2: The translation function $F_v:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated to vector $v$ is a linear operator
answer3: The reflection function $F:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ around the line y = x, defined by $F(x,y)=(y, x)$ is a non-orthogonal linear operator
answer4: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is a non-orthogonal linear operator

question: Indicate which of the following set of vectors is a spanning set of $\mathbb{R}^2$.

Throughout the week, a web store recorded the number of mobile phones sold per day:

$\begin{array}{ |l|c|c|c|c|c|c|c| } 
 \hline
 \text{Weekday}&\text{I} &\text{II} & \text{III} &\text{IV}& \text{V}&\text{VI}&\text{VII} \\ 
\hline
\text{Number of sold phones}& 12& 8&12&4&8&11&12 \\ 
 \hline
\end{array}$

Find the mode of the number of sold phones.
Choose the right answer:
answer1: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is an orthogonal linear operator
answer2: The translation function $F_v:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated to vector $v$ is a linear operator
answer3: The reflection function $F:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ around the line y = x, defined by $F(x,y)=(y, x)$ is a non-orthogonal linear operator
answer4: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is a non-orthogonal linear operator

question:
How many solutions does the following linear system have, with respect to $a\in\mathbb{R}$?
$$\left\{\begin{array}{cccccccc}
ax & + & y & + & 2az & = & a+5\\
ax & - & ay & - & z & = & a\\
x & - & ay & + & z & = & 3
\end{array}\right.$$
answer1: One solution for $a\neq 1$, and no solutions for $a=1$.
answer2: One solution for $a\neq 1,-1$, no solutions for $a=1$ and infinitely many solutions for $a=-1$.
answer4: No solutions for $a\neq 0$, and one solution for $a=0$.

answer3: There are $1$ local maximum and $1$ local minimum.

question:
Let $f\colon\mathbb{R}\to\mathbb{R}$ be the function defined by
\[
f(x)=1+x+x^2+\dots+x^{2019}=\sum_{k=0}^{2019} x^k.
\]

question: A box contains $3$ red balls, $5$ green balls and $7$ blue balls. If two balls are drawn from the box at random, returning the first ball to the box before drawing the second one, find the probability of drawing balls with different colours.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & - & y & + & 2z & - & 3t & = & 1 \\ 
2x & + & y & - & 2z & - & t & = & 2 \\ 
x &- &3y &+ &z &- &2t &= &-1 \\
  &   &      &     &z &- &t &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(5,\,1,\,3,\,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(5+20y,\,y,\,-10-13y,\,8+15y\right)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(5,0,-10,8\right)$ as its unique solution.

Consider the linear applications 

$\begin{array}{cccc}
F: & \mathbb{R}^3 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y, z) & \longrightarrow & (y, x-z)
\end{array}$
$\begin{array}{cccc}
G: & \mathbb{R}^2 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y) & \longrightarrow & (x+y, x-2y)
\end{array}$

Choose the right answer:
answer1: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)$ does not exist
answer2: $(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$and $(G\circ F)$ does not exist
answer3: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$
answer4: $(G\circ F)(y, x-z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)(x, y)=(x+y, x-2y)$

Consider the matrix 
$$A_k=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}
 1  & 1  & 0 \\

\end{array}\right]$$
and denote by $L(A_k)$ the space of the rows of the matrix $A_k$. Which of the following statements is true?
answer1: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, 1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer2: The dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$ for every $k\in \mathbb{R}$
answer3: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer4: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, -1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$

x & + & 2y & - & 3z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 2z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3 \\
x & + & y & - & z & + & w & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(z+w,\,z-w-1,\,z,\,w\right)$ as solution for all $z,w\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:

\text{Project} & \text{N. of programmers}  & \text{N. of analysts}  & \text{N. of terminals} \\
\hline
\text{A} & 2 & 2 & 3 \\
\text{B} & 3 & 6 & 1 \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]	

The company wants to minimize the cost of developing projects in the next period. $$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & - & 3z & + & 2t & = & 1 \\
2x & - & y & - & z & + & t & = & 0 \\
x & + & y & + & z & - & t & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are of the form $\bigg(-\frac{2}{3},\frac{1}{4}t-\frac{7}{12},\frac{3}{4}t-\frac{3}{4},t\bigg)$, for all $t\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\bigg(-\frac{2}{3},-\frac{7}{12},-\frac{3}{4},0\bigg)$ as unique solution.
answer4: The solution of the system is the vector of coordinates $(2,-1,0,0)$.

Find the integral curve which satisfies the equation $x+xx'=tx-x'$ with initial condition $x(2)=1$.
answer1: The integral curve that satisfies the initial condition is the curve $t-\frac{1}{2}t^{2}+x+\ln|x|=1$.
answer2: The integral curve that satisfies the initial condition is the curve $t-\frac{1}{2}t^{2}+x+\ln|x|=0$.
answer3: The integral curve that satisfies the initial condition is the curve $t-t^{2}+x+\ln|x|=1$.
answer4: The integral curve that satisfies the initial condition is the curve $t+\frac{1}{2}t^{2}+x-\ln|x|=0$.

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
6x & - & 11y & + & 2z & - & 9t & = & 2 \\
2x & + & y & - & 2z & - & t & = & 1 \\
x & - & 3y & + & z & - & 2t & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(0,\,1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(1+z,\,0,\,z,\,-z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(1-y,\,y,\,2+y,\,-y\right)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Consider the following linear programming problem to determine the optimum production schedule concerning three products $x_1$, $x_2$ and $x_3$ to maximize the profit regarding Company XLK Lda. The production of these products requires resources 1 and 2. 

\[\begin{array}{ll}	
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1}+x_{2}+5x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & 6x_{1}+3x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 45 \text{ (Resource 1)}\\
& 3x_{1}+4x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 30 \text{ (Resource 2)}\\
& x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~3\\	
\end{array}
\]	

Let $S_1$ and $S_2$ be the slack variables for the respective constraints. After we apply the simplex method, the final incomplete simplex tableau is:

\[
\begin{array}{l|ccccc|c}
& x_{1} & x_{2} & x_{3} &  S_{1} & S_{2} & \\
\hline
x_{1} & 1 & -1/3  & 0 &  1/3 & -1/3 & 5 \\
x_{3} & 0 & 1  & 1 &  -1/5 & 2/5 & 3 \\
\hline
& &   & &   & & \\
\end{array}
\]	

If a new contraint $2x_{1}+x_{2}+x_{3}\leq 40 $ is included, determine the solution based on the final complete simplex tableau.

Let $A$ be an invertible matrix and $k\neq 0$ a constant. Considering the following statements:

S1:  $\left(k\cdot A \right)^{-1}=k^{-1} \cdot A^{-1}$ and 
S2:  $\mathrm{det} \left(A^{-1} \right)=\left(\mathrm{det} \left(A \right)\right)^{-1}$,

which is the correct answer?
answer1: S1 and S2 are both true
answer2: S1 is true, S2 is false
answer3: S1 is false, S2 is true
answer4: S1 and S2 are both false

$$T(1,0,1)=(-2,4), \quad T(0,-1,2)=(5, 0), \quad T(0,0,3)=(-6,3)$$ 
Choose the right answer.

Describe the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 2y & - & 3z & = & 4 \\
x & + & 3y & - & z & = & 11 \\
2x & + & 5y & - & 5z & = & 13 \\
x & + & 4y & + & z & = & 18
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The linear system has $\left(4,\,3,\,2\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer2: The linear system has $\left(4,\,2,\,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The linear system has no solutions.
answer4: The linear system has infinitely many solutions, which are of the form $\left(2z,\,z+1,\,z\right)$ for each $z\in\mathbb{R}$.

question: Let $A= \{(1, -2, 0), (2, 3, 2), (3, 1, 2)\}$ and $B= \{(1, -2, 0), (1, 0, 2), (1, -1, 3)\}$ be sets of vectors of $\mathbb{R}^3$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $B$ is linearly independent but $A$ is not
answer3: $A$ is linearly independent but $B$ is not

question: Express $z=\operatorname{e}^{i3\pi}$ in the form $z=a+bi$.

The WorldLight Company produces two light fixtures (products $1$ and $2$) that require both metal frame parts and electrical components. Management wants to determine how many units of each product to produce so as to maximize profit. For each unit of product $1$, $1$ unit of frame parts and $2$ units of electrical components are required. For each unit of product $2$, $3$ units of frame parts and $2$ units of electrical components are required. The company has $200$ units of frame parts and $300$ units of electrical components. 

Each unit of product $1$ gives a profit of $1?$, and each unit of product $2$, up to $60$ units, gives a profit of $2?$. Any excess over	$60$ units of product $2$ brings no profit, so such excess has been ruled out.

How does the Linear Programming (LP) model should be formalized to allow planning of the company's activity?
answer1:
\[
\begin{array}{ll}
		\text{Maximize} & Z= x_{1} + 2x_{2}\\
		\text{subject to} & x_{1}+3x_{2}\leq 200\\
	        & 2x_{1}+2x_{2}\leq 300\\
			& x_{2}\leq 60\\
			&  x_{1},x_{2}\geq 0\\
\end{array}
\]
answer3:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
		\text{Minimize} & Z= x_{1} + 2x_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} & x_{1}+3x_{2}\leq 200\\
			    & 2x_{1}+2x_{2}\leq 300\\
			    & x_{2}\leq 60\\
			    & x_{1},x_{2}\geq 0\\
\end{array}
\]
answer4:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
		\text{Maximize} & Z= x_{1} + 2x_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} &  x_{1}+3x_{2}\leq 200\\
    			& 2x_{1}+2x_{2}\leq 300\\
			    & x_{2}\geq 60\\
			    & x_{1},x_{2}\geq 0\\
\end{array}
\]

question:
The conjunction of equations $\dfrac{2x-1}{3}=2-y=\dfrac{z+3}{2}$ determine a straight line $r$. 
Choose the right answer:
answer1: $r$ has the direction of $v=\bigg(\dfrac{3}{2}, -1, 2\bigg)$ and contains the point $P=\bigg(\dfrac{1}{2}, 2, -3\bigg)$.
answer2: $r$ has the direction of $v=(3, 1, 2)$ and contains the point $P=(1, 2, -3)$.
answer3: $r$ has the direction of $v=\bigg(\dfrac{3}{2}, 1, 2\bigg)$ and contains the point $P=\bigg(\dfrac{1}{2}, 2, -3\bigg)$.
answer4: $r$ has the direction of $v=(3, -1, 2)$ and contains the point $P=(1, 2, -3)$.

question: Choose the true statement.
answer1: A concave polygon may have a diagonal outside the polygon.
answer2: A convex polygon may have a diagonal outside the polygon.
answer3: The diagonals of a convex polygon are all congruent.
answer4: A diagonal can join two consecutive vertices of the polygon.

question: Consider the vectors of $\mathbb{R}^3$, $v_1=(2, 0, 1)$, $v_2=(1, -1, 3)$, $v_3=(1, 1, -2)$ and $v_4=(3, 1, 0)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: The set $\{v_1, v_2, v_3\}$ is linearly dependent but $\{v_1, v_2, v_4\}$ is linearly independent.
answer2: $v_4$ is a linear combination of $v_1$ and $v_3$
answer3: The space generated by $\{v_1, v_2, v_3\}$ is $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer4: $v_3$ is a linear combination of $v_2$ and $v_4$

question: Consider the subsets  $\displaystyle A=\{(1, 1, 1), (0, 1, 1), (1, 2, 3)\}$ and $\displaystyle B=\left\{(1, 1, 1), \left(-\frac{2}{3}, \frac{1}{3}, \frac{1}{3}\right), \left(0, -\frac{1}{2}, \frac{1}{2}\right)\right\}$ of $\mathbb{R}^3$. Choose the right answer:

x & + & 3y & - & z & + & w & = & -2 \\

2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are of the form $\bigg(\frac{22w+7}{15},\,\frac{-7w-7}{10},\,\frac{11w+11}{30}\bigg)$ for every $w\in\mathbb{R}$.

answer4: The system has $\left(3w,\,w-1,\,2w,\,w\right)$ as solution for every $w\in\mathbb{R}$.
